summary: Spreadsheet CSV file is used for importing and exporting spreadsheet metadata. The CSV file can be used to create new spreadsheets or update existing ones within directories.

headers.name: description
headers.description: Description for the spreadsheet in Markdown format.
examples: This spreadsheet contains quarterly sales data analysis

headers.name: directory
headers.description: Fully qualified name of the parent directory.

headers.name: mimeType
headers.description: MIME type of the spreadsheet file (GoogleSheets, Excel, CSV, TSV, Other).

headers.name: path
headers.description: Full path to the spreadsheet file.

headers.name: size
headers.description: File size in bytes (may be null for cloud-native files like Google Sheets).

headers.name: owners
headers.description: Owners of the spreadsheet. Multiple owners are separated by ';'. Each owner is specified as 'type:name' format.

headers.name: tags
headers.description: Fully qualified classification tag names associated with the spreadsheet separated by ';'.

headers.name: glossaryTerms
headers.description: Fully qualified glossary term names associated with the spreadsheet separated by ';'.

headers.name: domains
headers.description: Fully qualified names of the domains the spreadsheet belongs to, separated by ';'.

headers.name: dataProducts
headers.description: List of fully qualified names of data products this spreadsheet is part of, separated by ';'.

headers.name: experts
headers.description: Subject matter experts for this spreadsheet. Multiple experts are separated by ';'.

headers.name: reviewers
headers.description: Reviewers for this spreadsheet. Multiple reviewers are separated by ';'.
